comments.body:
So you want to get a conduit's effects without getting a conduit?

New nether resources aren't a bad idea, though.
Conduit power is new so why not have a second way to get it, cause prismarine is really hard to obtain
I love this

Why?  So far you’ve outlined a thing to add to the game and what it can do, but not why it would be useful or why people would want to do it.  Other than the obvious “so you can throw bouncy things” I guess....
@ClayGoddessSari Thank you for your comment, I will edit the post!
What’s the point?
Minecraft has redstone.  That is a fun purpose.

I was just going to post and ask for a ball to play dodgeball. I've built this big coliseum and I want one of the mini games to be dodgeball. Just 6 balls that don't break on impact but maybe give off an effect so spectators and refs can see someone has been hit and is out. Its fun with snowballs but kinda sucks because they go away after thrown and also if there are stacks on the court players get to throw unlimited balls.

wonderfull idea

You can also make balls that give different potion effect when they hit a player or a mob. You can craft them as the tipped arrow, with the lingerine potion. 

You can make differnt typeof balls. There is the regular one and it can be used for crafting.

For example if you sourround it with slime balls it will be more bouncy. If you sourround it with leather it will be less bouncy but you can thow it further. If you sourround it whit redstone it will give an input signal proportioned to the velocity of the ball in that moment to the block it is touching. If you sourround it with phantom membrane it will have an effect of slow falling (like a beachball).

You can also dye your ball with different color.

This is similar to my idea, except I would want this to be a free add-on that people can install, and I would want the ball to be a cube instead of a sphere. You should also be able to dye the ball with different dyes to customize the ball. Here is my idea: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/36703025019661-Bouncy-ball-add-on
Echo Shards would make a lot of sense in conjunction with a Mace, considering that both relate to the concepts of impact and waves.

I like these ideas. I like the Echo Horn especially because it makes two items that are next to useless much more helpful and sought after. It would be great to be able to see hostile mobs that are inside of caves so that you don’t have to worry about a surprise attack. It would also be great as it can help you find lost mobs. Maybe Echo Shards applied to horns from Screaming Goats allow you to see the detected mobs for longer than more common Goat Horns with Echo Shards applied to it. I hope this makes sense
We desperately need this. Could also call it a Sleeping Bag or Canvas.
Had this thought a few days ago, could definitely call it a sleeping bag and craft it with wool and string. The bit about not resetting the insomnia count is a good consideration.
I've wished for this
I think this is an awesome idea as well
It sounds like "blueprints" similar to trophy flag patterns, but for a blacksmith's table.

I think it would improve the game by not only solving a progression problem nowadays, but would be a GOOD reason to explore new dungeons and learn hidden mechanics in the game! Like, why would a full netherite player go to an Ancient City? If we were ONLY able to find advanced redstone recipes in there, it would be awesome! And if people don't want it, we could have a option that adds this mechanic.
Yes please and yes sirrrrrrrrrrr
another feature that would be kinda handy is if it draws in mobs because it's a sound. Though that could be a bad thing with a swarm of zombies.

I think wind should be in the game. It is in Minecraft Dungeons. Unless they added seasons (which they should do), the leaf piles would be a bit weird, since in real life, leaves don't usually fall off of trees unless it is fall/autumn.

I love this concept!

To add onto this, perhaps Lapis could be used as "ammo" for such Magic Book, similarly to Arrows with a Bow. Simply have the Lapis in your inventory and the Magic Book will work. Adds a cool new use to something we get a lot of! And this weapon would cast damaging spells like you said.

Additionally, Amethyst has only practical uses for such a magical-looking material. We could create a Magic Staff out of a few Gold Ingots and an Amethyst Shard, which could potentially cast helpful spells on allies, like healing, strength, speed, etc. This would use Lapis as ammo, as well.

Furthermore, we could upgrade the Magic Book and Magic Staff with Echo Shards to cast more potent spells. The upgraded Magic Book could cast powerful elemental spells that freeze, ignite, or electrocute enemies, while the upgraded Magic Staff could apply effects that aren't obtainable usually, like blindness, nausea, mining fatigue, etc.

This would finally give us some more variety in combat. With other games, I like to do magic-only playthroughs, but Minecraft just never had that option available. Hopefully something like this appears in 1.21 since they're thinking about sprucing up combat for those who enjoy it!
I think you should add some more mobs
I saw this suggestion on an older post. It was a good idea.
YES we need this to farm nether wart faster plz we need this

Phenomenal idea! Personally, I believe that instead of 0-2 Withered Bones 0-3 would be a more adequate design choice. The reason is that regular Skeletons drop 0-2 bones on average, so 0-3 would be better for the taller Wither Skeleton.

Instead of only Nether Wart, the Wither Bone Meal could also grow Huge Crimson and Huge Warped Fungi, and Warped/Crimson Vines.

There could be Withered Bone Blocks that are found in a Soul Sand Valley along with normal Bone Blocks.

Phenomenal idea! Personally, I believe that instead of 0-2 Withered Bones 0-3 would be a more adequate design choice. The reason is that regular Skeletons drop 0-2 bones on average, so 0-3 would be better for the taller Wither Skeleton.

Instead of only Nether Wart, the Wither Bone Meal could also grow Huge Crimson and Huge Warped Fungi, and Warped/Crimson Vines.

There could be Withered Bone Blocks that are found in a Soul Sand Valley along with normal Bone Blocks.
To be clear : Must be silent & no need to be powered (same as hopper, opposite of dispenser)
Firework shot.
I like that!
A green wood would be nice
Why doesn't this already exist?
If this gets added they should also add crafting 9 strings from cobwebs to java, then the cobweb recipe would just be that backwards.
I like this idea. Cobwebs are super useful for MLGs, PvP, and builders use them often for smoke and particles. Cobwebs should be renewable.
20 hours mining under mountains later, Im frustrated and angry... This really sucks and I cant find it
Put it into the Woodland mansion, give it a recovery compass color scheme. This is honestly perfect.
I think it would be great for building, and I think it is a great idea.
This would be a good thing in the game!
I like this got my vote
This is the best idea BUT it needs to be like the shulker a mob that looks like a block because in reality they are living creatures
A large collection of heads is great. But enchantments that specialize in the extraction of trophy loot of little use need more uses.
I think the enchantment name should be guillotine
It is necessary for the artificial intelligence to support the simulation of "nausea", otherwise it will not affect the mobs.
as a lingering one it simulates THIS TEXT IS IN QUARANTINE CUZ OF IT
I think instead of chicken it would be puffer fish because it all ready gives you naesia
Use the poisonous potato instead of chicken.
What if a player head was used?
Or be able to find spawn eggs in survival Minecraft
We need this so looters dont get inside and we need reinforced wood so you can only place and break it and looters cant and griefers cant
Quartz could be used to make the potion:

Quartz doesn't have anything directly to do with lava, so I woul recommend a few ideas...take or leave what you will.
Magma cream on night vision potions
Magma block on awkward potions
Fire charge on awkward potions
Blaze rod on night vision potions

I feel like fire charges are under used, and it would be great to use them I an alchemist's necessity like this. I actually do not want Magma block on awkward potions for the recipe because it is literally the fire resistance ingredient ×4, and this potion shouldn't grant that effect.
Just pouring out some ideas. The potion sounds awesome, and there is a definite need for sight under lava. There could be some really cool structures to build.
this would be perfect!!
This is absolute genius!
this is a great idea

I would also like to see milk bottles replace milk buckets in food recipes. Possibly milk bottles could also be used as the base (instead of a water bottle) to brew special potions that persist even if you drink a bucket of milk to remove multiple other unwanted status effects all at once. It'd be nice if milk bottles stacked to 16 like honey bottles, which also remove the poison effect.
I like this idea. Stacking to 16 is a decent limiter. I also think it would add a lot in terms of having available options for food/meals.
Would like it if added 😀
There is a mod with colored water.

One of these mods is ColoredWater on Curseforge. 
It was created by the user Cozary on Curseforge.
Copper is in desperate need of more uses.

The Copper Grate idea is the one I found most promising. That would definitely come to some use in mob farms. Good idea. Not sure about the other two. 

Also the general title of just "more copper items" is agreeable.
How about copper bowls or buckets ?
